pub_created_display: Ardashir I (224 to 240), 1/2Δ, Group / Mint C ("Ctesiphon")
issue_place_s: Group / Mint C ("Ctesiphon"), Asuristan, Sasanian Empire
issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Ardashir I on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: covered crown cap surmounted by covered korymbos; plain diadem; pendent diadem ribbons; tunica; dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o. mzdysn bgy 'rthštr MRKAn MRKA 'yr'n MNW ctry MN yzd'n| mazdēsn bay Ardašir šāhān šāh Ērān kē čihr az yazdān| "the Mazda-worshiping, divine Ardashir, King of Kings of the Iranians, whose image / brilliance is from the gods"; triplet between korymbos and upper ribbons (SNS 1, var.3)
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; round altar shaft; four altar slabs; altar flames depicted with vertical strokes; to the left and right mushroom-shaped bases supporting lion-paw structures; below left and right edge of altar table pendent diadem ribbon; dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o.  NWRA ZY- 2 h l. i. 'rthštr| ādur ī Ardašīr| “the fire of Ardashir”
issue_references_s: SNS 1 Phase3 Group / Mint C ("Ctesiphon) Type III/3a Flames 1
